contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox software | name = L0phtCrack | developer = Peiter Zatko ([[Mudge]]), Chris Wysopal ([[Weld Pond]]), Christien Rioux ([[DilDog]]), Rob Cheyne, Ian Melvin | operating_system = [[Microsoft Windows]] | latest_release_version = 6.0.15 | genre = [[password cracking|Password Cracking]], [[Information technology security audit|Operating System Audit]] | license = Proprietary | website = [http://www.l0phtcrack.com/ l0phtcrack] }} '''L0phtCrack''' is a [[password]] [[audit]]ing and [[password cracking|recovery]] application (now called ''L0phtCrack 6'') originally produced by [[Peiter Zatko|Mudge]] from [[l0pht|L0pht Heavy Industries]]. It is used to test [[password strength]] and sometimes to recover lost [[Microsoft Windows]] passwords, by using [[dictionary attack|dictionary]], [[brute force attack|brute-force]], hybrid attacks, and [[rainbow tables]].<ref name=sectools>{{cite web |url=http://sectools.org/tools2.html |title=Top 100 Network Security Tools (Page 2/4) |accessdate=2008-09-18}}</ref> It was one of the [[Black hat hacking|crackers']] tools of choice, although most use old versions because of its low price and high availability. The application was produced by [[@stake]] after the L0pht merged with @stake in 2000. @stake was then acquired by [[Symantec]] in 2004.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.eweek.com/c/a/Security/Symantec-Buys-Security-Consulting-Pioneer-stake/ |title=Symantec Buys Security Consulting Pioneer @stake |last=Fisher |first=Dennis |publisher=eWeek |date=2004-09-16}}</ref> Symantec later stopped selling this tool to new customers, citing [[export of cryptography in the United States|US Government export regulations]], and discontinued support in December 2006.<ref name=sectools /><ref name=pullsplug>{{cite news |url=http://www.eweek.com/article2/0,1895,1935616,00.asp |title=Symantec Pulls Plug on L0phtCrack |date=2006-03-08 |last=Naraine |first=Ryan |accessdate=2008-09-18}}</ref> In January 2009 L0phtCrack was acquired by the original authors Zatko, Wysopal, and Rioux from Symantec. L0phtCrack 6 was announced on 11 March 2009 at the SOURCE Boston Conference.<ref name="ver6-announcement">{{cite web |url=http://www.infosecurity-magazine.com/view/468/new-version-of-l0phtcrack-to-be-unveiled-next-week/ |title=New version of L0phtcrack to be unveiled next week |work=Infosecurity Magazine |date=2009-03-03 |accessdate=2009-05-29 }}</ref> L0phtCrack 6 contains support for 64-bit Windows platforms as well as upgraded rainbow tables support.<ref name="rises-from-ashes">{{cite news |url=http://www.theregister.co.uk/2009/05/27/l0phtcrack_returns/ |title=Seminal password tool rises from Symantec ashes |last=Goodin |first=Dan |date=2009-05-27 |work=[[The Register]]}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.l0phtcrack.com/ L0phtCrack Website] {{Password_Cracking_Software}} {{L0pht Footer}} [[Category:L0pht]] [[Category:Password cracking software]] {{Security-software-stub}}
